fields.name: socketPortMetrics
fields.description:
Provides historical metrics for physical and logical interfaces on Cato Sockets.
This API enables detailed monitoring of LAN, WAN, Tunnel, Bypass, and Off-Cloud traffic, including throughput, bandwidth usage, and cellular signal quality.

args.name: accountID
args.description: Account ID

fields.name: socketPortMetricsTimeSeries
fields.description:
Provides historical time series metrics for physical and logical interfaces on Cato Sockets.
This API enables detailed monitoring of LAN, WAN, Tunnel, Bypass, and Off-Cloud traffic, including throughput, bandwidth usage, and cellular signal quality.

args.name: accountID
args.description: Account ID

fields.name: accountMetrics
fields.description:
The accountMetrics query helps you analyze the state and quality of the connections
of sites and SDP users to the Cato Cloud. This data is for the traffic inside the DTLS
tunnel between the site and the Cato Cloud. accountMetrics shows historical metrics,
statics, and analytics for the account.

args.name: accountID
args.description: Unique Identifier of Account.

args.name: timeFrame
args.description: The time frame for the data that the query returns. The argument is in the format type.time value. This argument is mandatory.

args.name: groupInterfaces
args.description:
When the boolean argument groupInterfaces is set to __true__, then the data for all the
interfaces are aggregated to a single interface.

args.name: groupDevices
args.description:
When the boolean argument groupDevices is set to __true__, then the analytics for all the
Sockets (usually two in high availability) are aggregated as one result.

For the best results for aggregated Sockets, we recommend that there is consistent
names and functionality (for example Destination) for the links on both Sockets.

fields.name: entityLookup
fields.description: Lookup entities with a specific type, potentially filtered and paged

args.name: accountID
args.description: The account ID (or 0 for non-authenticated requests)

args.name: type
args.description: Type of entity to lookup for

args.name: limit
args.description: Sets the maximum number of items to retrieve

args.name: from
args.description: Sets the offset number of items (for paging)

args.name: parent
args.description:
Return items under a parent entity (can be site, vpn user, etc),
used to filter for networks that belong to a specific site for example

args.name: search
args.description:
Adds additional search parameters for the lookup. Available options:
country lookup: "removeExcluded" to return only allowed countries
countryState lookup: country code ("US", "CN", etc) to get country's states

args.name: entityIDs
args.description:
Adds additional search criteria to fetch by the selected list of entity IDs. This option is not
universally available, and may not be applicable specific Entity types. If used on non applicable entity
type, an error will be generated.

args.name: sort
args.description:
Adds additional sort criteria(s) for the lookup.
This option is not universally available, and may not be applicable specific Entity types.

args.name: filters
args.description: Custom filters for entityLookup

args.name: helperFields
args.description: Additional helper fields

args.name: subdomains
args.description: a list of required subdomains

fields.name: subDomains
fields.description:
The subdomain query helps you retrieve the URL of an account. The usage of this query supports 3 different scenarios:
1. Regular account - Return only 1 subdomain relating to the regular account
2. Reseller account - Return all subdomains including the reseller account subdomain
3. Reseller account - Return only the reseller account subdomain

args.name: accountID
args.description: Unique Identifier of Account

args.name: managedAccount
args.description: When the boolean argument managedAccount is set to true (default), then the query returns all subdomains related to the account

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: groups
fields.description: Mutations for creating, updating, or deleting groups

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: MicrosoftEndpoint
types.description: The `MicrosoftEndpoint` object represents a comprehensive data structure used in GraphQL queries or mutations, containing fields related to security alerts, device details, threat predictions, and other metadata associated with Microsoft's security ecosystem.

types.name: MicrosoftDeviceDetails
types.description: The `MicrosoftDeviceDetails` object represents detailed information about a Microsoft device, including its antivirus status, Azure AD device ID, device name, first seen date and time, health status, IP interfaces, logged-on users, onboarding status, operating system details, and RBAC group.

types.name: MicrosoftEndpointUser
types.description: The `MicrosoftEndpointUser` object represents a user associated with a Microsoft endpoint, containing fields such as account name, domain name, unique identifier, user name, principal name, and user security identifier.

types.name: MicrosoftDefenderEndpointAlert
types.description: The `MicrosoftDefenderEndpointAlert` object represents an alert generated by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, containing details such as activities, classification, criticality, detection source, and recommended actions, among other attributes, to help in identifying and managing security threats.

types.name: MicrosoftProcessResource
types.description: The `MicrosoftProcessResource` object represents a process resource in a Microsoft environment, containing fields such as creation date, process ID, command line details, remediation status, roles, tags, user account information, and a verdict on the process's nature.

types.name: MicrosoftFileResource
types.description: The `MicrosoftFileResource` object represents a file resource in a Microsoft system, containing fields such as creation date, detection and remediation status, file details, unique identifier, roles, tags, and a verdict on the file's status.

types.name: MicrosoftRegistryResource
types.description: The `MicrosoftRegistryResource` object represents a registry resource in a Microsoft environment, containing fields such as creation date, hive, key, remediation status, roles, tags, and verdict, which are used to manage and assess the resource's status and attributes.

types.name: MicrosoftNetworkResource
types.description: The `MicrosoftNetworkResource` object represents a registry resource in a Microsoft environment, containing fields such as creation date, remediation status, roles, tags, and verdict, which are used to manage and assess the resource's status and attributes.

types.name: MicrosoftActivity
types.description: The `MicrosoftActivity` object represents an activity within Microsoft services, containing fields such as action type, timestamps for the first and last activity, and identifiers for the activity and its associated resources.

types.name: TimeFrame
types.description:
Enter the time frame for the data that the query returns. The argument is in the format \.\ This argument is mandatory. These are the supported options to define the time frame: last.\ - The value for the last type is according to ISO-8601 and returns data for the previous specific times. For example:
  • timeFrame = last.PT5M shows the previous 5 minutes
  • timeFrame = last.PT2H shows the previous 2 hours
  • timeFrame = last.P1D shows the previous 1 day
  • timeFrame = last.P3M shows the previous 3 months
  • timeFrame = last.P1Y shows the previous 1 year
utc.\ - The time frame combines a start and end date in the format YY-MM-DD/hh:mm:ss
according to the specified time zone.
You must enter all the date and time values for the argument. For example:
  • timeFrame = utc.2020-02-{11/04:50:00--21/04:50:00} shows 10 days of analytics data from February 11, 2020 4:50:00 am to February 21, 2020 4:50:00 am
  • timeFrame = utc.2020-02-11/{04:50:15--16:50:15} shows 12 hours of analytics data on February 11, 2020, from 4:50:15 am to 16:50:15 pm
  • timeFrame = utc.2020-{02-11/04:50:00--04-11/04:50:00} shows 2 months of analytics data from February 11, 2020 4:50:00 am to April 11 4:50:00 am
  • timeFrame = utc.{2019-10-01/04:50:00--2020/02-01/04:50:00} shows 4 months of analytics data from October 1, 2019 4:50:00 am to February 11 4:50:00 am
This format lets you configure a time frame the includes more than one calendar year

inputFields.name: connectionMode
inputFields.description:
Determines the protocol for establishing the Security Association (SA) Tunnel. Valid values are:
Responder-Only Mode: Cato Cloud only responds to incoming requests by the initiator (e.g. a Firewall device) to establish a security association.
Bidirectional Mode: Both Cato Cloud and the peer device on customer site can initiate the IPSec SA establishment.

inputFields.name: identificationType
inputFields.description: The authentication identification type used for SA authentication. When using “BIDIRECTIONAL”, it is set to “IPv4” by default. Other methods are available in Responder mode only.

inputFields.name: initMessage
inputFields.description: The init message parameters

inputFields.name: authMessage
inputFields.description: The auth message parameters.

inputFields.name: networkRanges
inputFields.description: The local IP ranges for the SAs

inputFields.name: cipher
inputFields.description: The SA tunnel encryption method. Note: For situations where GCM isn’t supported for the INIT phase, we recommend that you use the CBC algorithm for the INIT phase, and GCM for AUTH

inputFields.name: dhGroup
inputFields.description: The Diffie-Hellman Group. The first number is the DH-group number, and the second number is the corresponding prime modulus size in bits

inputFields.name: integrity
inputFields.description: The algorithm used to verify the integrity and authenticity of IPsec packets

inputFields.name: prf
inputFields.description: The Pseudo-random function (PRF) used to derive the cryptographic keys used in the SA establishment process

inputFields.name: downstream
inputFields.description: The maximum downstream bandwidth from the Cato Cloud to the site, in Mbps. This value can be used for capping the downstream traffic. It should not be set above the ISP downstream bandwidth or the site license bandwidth.

inputFields.name: upstream
inputFields.description: The maximum upstream bandwidth, in Mbps. The Cato Cloud cannot cap this direction, and this setting is used as a best-effort indication by the Cato Cloud.

inputFields.name: downstreamMbpsPrecision
inputFields.description: The maximum downstream bandwidth from the Cato Cloud to the site, in Mbps with single decimal precision. This value can be used for capping the downstream traffic. It should not be set above the ISP downstream bandwidth or the site license bandwidth.

inputFields.name: upstreamMbpsPrecision
inputFields.description: The maximum upstream bandwidth, in Mbps with single decimal precision. The Cato Cloud cannot cap this direction, and this setting is used as a best-effort indication by the Cato Cloud.

enumValues.name: filterByConnectionTypeFamily
enumValues.description:
Custom filter to be used with Site entityLookup, to get only sites with one connection type, possible values:
"SOCKET",
"IPSEC",
"vSOCKET",
"PHYSICAL_SOCKET"

enumValues.name: filterByConnectionType
enumValues.description:
Custom filter to be used with Site entityLookup, to get only sites with one connection type, possible values (there are more values that can supported):
"SOCKET_X1500",
"SOCKET_X1600",
"SOCKET_X1700",
"VSOCKET_VGX_ESX",
"VSOCKET_VGX_AWS"
"VSOCKET_VGX_AZURE"
"SOCKET_X1600_LTE",

enumValues.name: filterByAltWan
enumValues.description:
Custom filter to be used with Site entityLookup, to get only sites with Alt WAN, possible values:
"true",
"false",

enumValues.name: filterByBackhaulingGW
enumValues.description:
Custom filter to be used with Site entityLookup, to get only sites that are configured as backhauling gateways, possible values:
"true",
"false",

enumValues.name: filterByOffCloudTransportEnabled
enumValues.description:
Custom filter to be used with Site entityLookup, to get only sites that are configured as OffCloudTransportEnabled, possible values:
"true",
"false",

enumValues.name: country
enumValues.description: Custom filter for country, used by city and state entityLookup

enumValues.name: state
enumValues.description: Custom filter for state used by city entityLookup

types.name: TimeZone
types.description: Time zone identifier E.g.: America/New_York

types.description: Wall time. E.g.: 12:34:56 or 12:34

types.name: Map
types.description:
A generic key-value map.

Represents an arbitrary JSON object, e.g.:
{ "key1": "value1", "key2": "value2" }

Keys must be strings, and values can be of any valid JSON type (string, number, boolean, array, or object).

types.name: IPAddress
types.description: An IPv4 IP address

types.name: Domain
types.description:
Top level domain is actually second level domain (e.g. example.com)
It is recommended to use as a broad way of distinguishing domains, because they **frequently use multiple hosts**.

types.name: Fqdn
types.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name: An exact host name (e.g. www.example.com)

types.name: Vlan
types.description: VLAN Identifier. A number in the range 1-4094 used to uniquely identify a Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN) in networking environments

types.name: ApplicationRisk
types.description: Application Risk

types.name: SHA_256
types.description: A 64-character hex string representing a SHA-256 hash. Typically used for secure validation and cryptographic integrity checks

types.name: Email
types.description: Email address. E.g.: user@company.org

types.name: Phone
types.description: Phone number. E.g.: +1 505 333 4070

types.name: Port
types.description: Network port number. Must be in range [0-65535] E.g.: 433, 8080, 80, etc..

types.name: Asn16
types.description: 16 bit autonomous system number [0-65535]

types.name: Asn32
types.description: 32 bit autonomous system number [0-4294967295]

types.name: Url
types.description: A Uniform Resource Locator, colloquially known as an address on the Web. E.g.: http://www.example.com/page/

types.name: MacAddress
types.description: FF:FF:FF:FF OR FF-FF-FF-FF

types.description: Http header name

types.name: FloatingSubnetRef
types.description:
Returns data for the Floating Subnet object. Floating Subnets (ie. Floating Ranges) are used to identify traffic exactly matched
to the route advertised by BGP. They are not associated with a specific site.
This is useful in scenarios such as active-standby high availability routed via BGP.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique Floating Subnet ID

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name for the Floating Subnet

types.name: FloatingSubnetRefInput
types.description:
Defines the Floating Subnet object. Floating Subnets (ie. Floating Ranges) are used to identify traffic exactly matched
to the route advertised by BGP. They are not associated with a specific site.
This is useful in scenarios such as active-standby high availability routed via BGP.

types.name: PolicyMutationError
types.description:
The `PolicyMutationError` enum defines various error messages related to policy publishing in the policy platform service.

## Policy Errors

### `ConcurrentPolicyPublish`
- **Error Message:** "Another policy is currently publishing"

### `PolicyRevisionMismatch`
- **Error Message:** "Revision is not owned by the admin"

### `PolicyRevisionNotFound`
- **Error Message:** "Revision was not found"

### `PolicyInvalidEntity`
- **Error Message:** "Invalid entity"

### `DuplicateRuleName`
- **Error Message:** "Rule with the same name already exists"

### `DuplicateSectionName`
- **Error Message:** "Section with the same name already exists"

### `PolicyFailure`
- **Error Message:** "Can’t publish policy due to an internal error. Please try again in a few minutes"


## Rule Errors

### `ruleIsLocked`
- **Error Message:** "Rule is locked by another revision"

### `ruleWasRemoved`
- **Error Message:** "Rule was already removed"

### `ruleNotExist`
- **Error Message:** "Rule does not exist"

### `ruleSectionNotExist`
- **Error Message:** "Section does not exist"

### `ruleSectionIsLocked`
- **Error Message:** "Section is locked by another revision"

### `rulePositionInvalid`
- **Error Message:** "Rule position is invalid"

### `ruleNameIsEmpty`
- **Error Message:** "Rule name can't be empty"

### `ruleNameAlreadyExists`
- **Error Message:** "Rule with the same name already exists"

### `ruleSystemModification`
- **Error Message:** "Can't modify a system rule"

### `ruleSystemMove`
- **Error Message:** "Can't add a rule above the system rules"

### `ruleHasInvalidEntity`
- **Error Message:** "Rule has an invalid entity"

### `failedValidatingRule`
- **Error Message:** "Something went wrong, couldn't validate rule"


## Section Errors

### `sectionIsLocked`
- **Error Message:** "Section is locked by another revision"

### `sectionSystemMove`
- **Error Message:** "Section with system rules cannot be moved or removed"

### `sectionNotExist`
- **Error Message:** "Section does not exist"

### `sectionPositionInvalid`
- **Error Message:** "Section position is invalid"

inputFields.name: alert
inputFields.defaultValue: {enabled: false, frequency: HOURLY, subscriptionGroup: [], webhook: [], mailingList: []}

inputFields.name: site
inputFields.description:
The sites the policy will be enforced on.
Socket sites only, with Socket v22 onwards.

inputFields.name: source
inputFields.description:
Source traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.
inputFields.defaultValue: {vlan: [], ipRange: [], group: [], subnet: [], networkInterface: [], systemGroup: [], host: [], ip: [], globalIpRange: [], floatingSubnet: [], siteNetworkSubnet: []}

inputFields.name: destination
inputFields.description:
Destination traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.
inputFields.defaultValue: {vlan: [], ipRange: [], subnet: [], networkInterface: [], systemGroup: [], host: [], ip: [], globalIpRange: [], group: [], floatingSubnet: [], siteNetworkSubnet: []}

inputFields.name: direction
inputFields.description: Direction of the traffic initiator matching criteria.

inputFields.name: service
inputFields.description: Destination service matching criteria for the rule. Port/Protocol based.

inputFields.name: nat
inputFields.description: Optionally, enable NAT on the outgoing interface. This translates all originating IPs to one NAT IP.

inputFields.name: transport
inputFields.description:
The transport of the matching traffic.
Either govern traffic to be routed locally (LAN), or to the PoP(WAN).
Traffic is send to the WAN by default.
Traffic routed in the LAN, enforced by the LAN Firewall rules.

inputFields.name: rule
inputFields.description: Parameters for the rule you are adding

inputFields.description: Position of the rule in the policy

types.name: GroupsQueries
types.description: Queries for reading groups-related information

fields.name: group
fields.description: Get a specific group configuration. The group can be identified by ID or name.

fields.name: whereUsed
fields.description: Check which policies use the group.

fields.name: groupList
fields.description:
Get a list of groups, with optional filters and sorting.
This query only returns basic information for each group (e.g. name, ID).
To view full configuration details, including members, use the `group` query for each result.

types.name: Group
types.description:
A group is a collection of typed members (e.g., sites, hosts).
Groups can include members of different types.

When you update a group or use it in a policy, the system verifies that all members are allowed in the policy's scope.
If a group is used in a policy that doesn’t support certain member types, you can't add those types to the group.
If a group already includes unsupported types, you can only assign it to a policy that supports those types.
A member type is valid if it's supported in the group and allowed in the policy scope.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for the group.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the group (not guaranteed to be globally unique).

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional free-text description for documentation or context

fields.name: audit
fields.description: Contains creation and modification metadata for the group

fields.name: members
fields.description: Lists the members in this group. Supports paging, filtering, and sorting by type and name

args.name: input
args.defaultValue: {paging: {limit: 100, from: 0}, sort: {name: {direction: ASC, priority: 2}, type: {direction: ASC, priority: 1}}}

fields.name: membersCount
fields.description: Total number of group members. When paging and filtering is used, this number may be higher than the number of members returned by the query

fields.name: membersCountPerType
fields.description: Breakdown of member count by type (e.g., number of sites, hosts, etc.).

types.name: GroupWhereUsedPayload
types.description:
Describes where the group is used across policies and scopes.

Includes a list of policy scopes where the group is applied,
and identifies any member types that are not supported in those policy scopes.

fields.name: used
fields.description: Value is True if the group is used in at least one policy or scope.

fields.name: usage
fields.description: List of scopes where the group is used. Each scope indicates the policy type and field.

fields.name: invalidMemberTypes
fields.description: Member types in the group that are not valid in one or more scopes where the group is used.

types.name: InvalidGroupMemberTypeInScope
types.description:
Represents a member type in the group that is not supported in one or more scopes.
Each scope indicates where the member type is not allowed.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The unsupported member type (e.g., site, host, etc.)

fields.name: scope
fields.description: List of scopes (policy type and field) where this member type is not supported.

types.name: GroupScope
types.description:
The scope (context) in which a group is used or supported.
Includes the policy type and the specific field name(s) where the group is used.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of policy (e.g.,WAN Firewall).

fields.name: field
fields.description: The specific fields within the policy where the group is used (e.g., 'source', 'destination').

types.name: GroupMembersListPayload
types.description: A list of group members, pagination details, applied filters, and sorting information.

fields.name: items
fields.description: List of members that matched the query (including filtering, sorting, and paging).

fields.name: paging
fields.description: Pagination information for the result set (e.g., offset, total count).

types.name: GroupMembersListInput
types.description: Filter, sort, and pagination applied when fetching the the list of group members.

types.name: GroupMembersListFilterInput
types.description: Filters to narrow down group members that are fetched.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Filter group members by name

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: Filter group members by type

types.name: GroupMembersListSortInput
types.description:
Sort group members by one or more fields.
If multiple fields are specified, the system uses their priority to determine order. For example, type with priority 1 will be used first, then name with priority 2.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Sort by member name

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: Sort by member type

types.name: GroupMemberRefTyped
types.description:
Reference to a group member, including its ID, name, and type.
Used when listing or identifying members within a group.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Object's unique identifier

fields.name: name
fields.description: Object's unique name

types.name: GroupMemberRefTypedInput
types.description: A reference to a group member, used when adding or filtering members.

inputFields.name: input
inputFields.description: The value of the member identifier (ID or name)

inputFields.name: by
inputFields.description: Whether to resolve the reference by ID or name. Defaults to ID.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The member type.

types.name: GroupMemberTypeCount
types.description: Counts how many members of each type the group contains.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The member type (e.g., SITE, HOST)

fields.name: membersCount
fields.description: Number of members of this type that belong to the group

types.name: GroupListInput
types.description: List groups with optional filters, sorting, and pagination.

inputFields.name: filter
inputFields.description: Filter groups by ID, name, member, audit data, or free-text

inputFields.name: paging
inputFields.description: Pagination settings

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: Sorting options, default behavior is ascending by name

types.name: GroupListFilterInput
types.description: Apply filters when fetching the list of groups.

inputFields.name: freeText
inputFields.description: Free-text search across textual fields like name

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Filter by group ID

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Filter by group name

inputFields.name: member
inputFields.description: Filter groups that include specific members

inputFields.name: audit
inputFields.description: Filter by audit metadata (e.g., created by)

types.name: GroupMemberFilterInput
types.description: Filter groups by member reference.

inputFields.name: ref
inputFields.description: Member reference used to identify the groups it belongs to

types.name: GroupMemberRefType
types.description: Member types that can be referenced in a group.

types.name: GroupMemberRefTypeFilterInput
types.description: Filter member types using the supported operators

inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Match if member type equals this value

inputFields.name: neq
inputFields.description: Match if member type does not equal this value

inputFields.name: in
inputFields.description: Match if member type is in this list

inputFields.name: nin
inputFields.description: Match if member type is not in this list

types.name: GroupListSortInput
types.description: Sort groups by name or audit metadata

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: ort groups by name

inputFields.name: audit
inputFields.description: Sort groups by audit metadata (e.g., creation time)

types.name: GroupListPayload
types.description: A list of groups returned by the groupList query, with pagination info.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The list of fetched groups

fields.name: paging
fields.description: Pagination that was applied during the fetch

types.name: GroupsMutations
types.description: Operations for managing groups

fields.name: createGroup
fields.description: Create a new group

fields.name: updateGroup
fields.description: Update an existing group, including attributes such as name, description, and member items

fields.name: deleteGroup
fields.description: Delete a group

types.name: CreateGroupInput
types.description: Create a new group

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the new group

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Optional description for the group

inputFields.name: members
inputFields.description: Initial list of members for the new group. There is a maximum of 500 members per createGroup mutation

types.name: CreateGroupPayload
types.description: The created group object.

types.name: UpdateGroupInput
types.description:
Update attributes for a group. Only the provided fields are updated - the other fields are not changed
Note: You can only update a total of 500 group members at one time, this means 'membersToAdd + membersToRemove' or 'members' must be less than 500

inputFields.name: group
inputFields.description: Specify the group you’re updating

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: New name for the group, if changing

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: New description for the group, if changing

inputFields.name: members
inputFields.description: Replaces all members in the group with this list of members

inputFields.name: membersToAdd
inputFields.description: Adds members to the existing set of members. Can't be used together with the 'members' field

inputFields.name: membersToRemove
inputFields.description: Removes members from the group. Can't be used together with the 'members' field

types.name: UpdateGroupPayload
types.description: The updated group object

fields.name: group
fields.description: Updated group

types.name: DeleteGroupPayload
types.description: The deleted group object

fields.name: group
fields.description: The group that was deleted

fields.name: preferredPopLocation
fields.description: Only relevant for socket sites

fields.name: preferredOnly
fields.description: Forces the socket to connect exclusively to the configured PoP locations

inputFields.name: preferredPopLocation
inputFields.description: Only relevant for socket sites

inputFields.name: primary
inputFields.description:
Set the location reference to -1, `Automatic`, or null to enable automatic selection.
Set the location reference to -2 or `None` to disable the preferred PoP location (only allowed for secondary).

inputFields.name: preferredOnly
inputFields.description: Forces the socket to connect exclusively to the configured PoP locations

types.name: InternetFirewallActionEnum
types.description: The action applied by the Internet Firewall if the rule is matched

enumValues.name: BLOCK
enumValues.description: Deny the network traffic from passing through the firewall.

enumValues.name: ALLOW
enumValues.description: Allow the network traffic to pass through the firewall.

enumValues.name: PROMPT
enumValues.description: Requests user confirmation to allow or block network traffic.

enumValues.name: RBI
enumValues.description: Apply Remote Browser Isolation (RBI) to the network traffic

inputFields.name: source
inputFields.description:
Source traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.
inputFields.defaultValue: {ip: [], host: [], site: [], subnet: [], ipRange: [], globalIpRange: [], networkInterface: [], siteNetworkSubnet: [], floatingSubnet: [], user: [], usersGroup: [], group: [], systemGroup: []}

inputFields.name: connectionOrigin
inputFields.description: Connection origin of the traffic

inputFields.name: country
inputFields.description:
Source country traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

inputFields.name: device
inputFields.description:
Source Device Profile traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

inputFields.name: deviceOS
inputFields.description:
Source device Operating System traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

inputFields.name: deviceAttributes
inputFields.description:
Additional device attributes such as category, type, model, and manufacturer.
Logical 'OR' is applied within the criteria set.
Logical 'AND' is applied between criteria sets.

inputFields.name: destination
inputFields.description:
Destination traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Policy ID

fields.description: Name of the policy, the default name for the policy containing all sub-policies is 'Main'

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description for the policy

fields.description: Holds a list of all allowed sub-policies according to admin access capabilities

fields.name: access
fields.description: Holds the complete set of access capabilities and limitations associated with the entity.

inputFields.name: revision
inputFields.description:
A revision is a specific instance of the policy.
 Unpublished revisions are working copies of the policy available to a specific
 admin or a set of admins
 Published revisions are revisions that were applied to the account network.
 The last published revision is the active policy.

types.name: InternetFirewallPolicyMutationPayload
types.description: Internet Firewall policy information provided in the API response

types.name: InternetFirewallPolicyMutations
types.description: The Internet firewall Policy information returned to the caller in the API response.

fields.name: addRule
fields.description: Add a new rule to the Internet Firewall policy.

fields.name: updateRule
fields.description: Update an existing rule of the Internet Firewall policy.

fields.name: removeRule
fields.description: Remove an existing rule from the Internet Firewall policy.

fields.name: moveRule
fields.description: Change the relative location of an existing rule within the Internet Firewall policy.

fields.name: addSection
fields.description:
Add a new section to the policy.
First section behaves as follows:
When the first section is created,  all the rules in the policy, including the default system rules, are automatically added to it.
The first section containing the default system rules can be modified but not deleted.
The first section will always remain first-in-policy, i.e. it cannot be moved, and not other sections can be moved or created before it.

fields.name: updateSection
fields.description: Update policy section attributes

fields.name: removeSection
fields.description: Delete an existing section. The first section in policy cannot be deleted.

fields.name: moveSection
fields.description:
Move a section to a new position within the policy.
 The section will be anchored in the new position, i.e. other admins will not be able to move it, or reference it when moving other sections, until the modified policy revision is published.

fields.name: createPolicyRevision
fields.description: Create the policy revision. Create a new empty policy revision.

fields.name: publishPolicyRevision
fields.description: Publish the policy revision. A published revision becomes the active policy, and its content is merged with all unpublished revisions for other admins.

fields.name: discardPolicyRevision
fields.description: Discard the policy revision. All changes in this discarded revision are discarded, and the revision is deleted.

fields.name: updatePolicy
fields.description:
Change the state of the policy, e.g. enable or disable the policy.
Applicable to the published policy only. State changes are applied immediately and not as part of publishing a policy revision.

fields.name: addSubPolicy
fields.description: Add a new sub-policy to the Internet Firewall policy.

fields.name: removeSubPolicy
fields.description: Remove an existing sub-policy from the Internet Firewall policy.

fields.name: policyList
fields.description: Provides a list of all policies of Internet Firewall with filtering, pagination and sorting capabilities

args.name: input
args.defaultValue: {sort: {name: {direction: ASC, priority: 1}, policyLevel: {direction: ASC, priority: 2}}, paging: {limit: 100, from: 0}}

fields.name: id
fields.description: Policy ID

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the policy, the default name for the policy containing all sub-policies is 'Main'

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description for the policy

fields.name: subPolicies
fields.description: Holds a list of all allowed sub-policies according to admin access capabilities

fields.name: access
fields.description: Holds the complete set of access capabilities and limitations associated with the entity.

inputFields.name: revision
inputFields.description:
A revision is a specific instance of the policy.
 Unpublished revisions are working copies of the policy available to a specific
 admin or a set of admins
 Published revisions are revisions that were applied to the account network.
 The last published revision is the active policy.

types.name: WanFirewallPolicyMutationPayload
types.description: Wan Firewall policy information provided in the API response

types.name: WanFirewallPolicyMutations
types.description: The Wan Firewall Policy information returned to the caller in the API response.

fields.name: addRule
fields.description: Add a new rule to the Wan Firewall policy.

fields.name: updateRule
fields.description: Update an existing rule of the Wan Firewall policy.

fields.name: removeRule
fields.description: Remove an existing rule from the Wan Firewall policy.

fields.name: moveRule
fields.description: Change the relative location of an existing rule within the Wan Firewall policy.

fields.name: addSection
fields.description:
Add a new section to the policy.
First section behaves as follows:
When the first section is created,  all the rules in the policy, including the default system rules, are automatically added to it.
The first section containing the default system rules can be modified but not deleted.
The first section will always remain first-in-policy, i.e. it cannot be moved, and not other sections can be moved or created before it.

fields.name: updateSection
fields.description: Update policy section attributes

fields.name: removeSection
fields.description: Delete an existing section. The first section in policy cannot be deleted.

fields.name: moveSection
fields.description:
Move a section to a new position within the policy.
 The section will be anchored in the new position, i.e. other admins will not be able to move it, or reference it when moving other sections, until the modified policy revision is published.

fields.name: updatePolicy
fields.description:
Change the state of the policy, e.g. enable or disable the policy.
Applicable to the published policy only. State changes are applied immediately and not as part of publishing a policy revision.

fields.name: addSubPolicy
fields.description: Add a new sub-policy to the Wan Firewall policy.

fields.name: removeSubPolicy
fields.description: Remove an existing sub-policy from the Wan Firewall policy.

fields.name: policyList
fields.description: Provides a list of all policies of Wan Firewall with filtering, pagination and sorting capabilities

args.name: input
args.defaultValue: {sort: {name: {direction: ASC, priority: 1}, policyLevel: {direction: ASC, priority: 2}}, paging: {limit: 100, from: 0}}

fields.name: id
fields.description: Rule ID

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the rule

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description for the rule

fields.name: index
fields.description: Position / priority of rule

fields.name: section
fields.description: Policy section where the rule is located

fields.name: enabled
fields.description:
TRUE = Rule is enabled 
 FALSE = Rule is disabled

fields.name: source
fields.description:
Source traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: connectionOrigin
fields.description: Connection origin of the traffic

fields.name: country
fields.description:
Source country traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: device
fields.description:
Source Device Profile traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: deviceOS
fields.description:
Source device Operating System traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: deviceAttributes
fields.description:
Additional device attributes such as category, type, model, and manufacturer.
Logical 'OR' is applied within the criteria set.
Logical 'AND' is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: destination
fields.description:
Destination traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: application
fields.description:
Application traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: service
fields.description:
Destination service traffic matching criteria.
Logical ‘OR’ is applied within the criteria set.
Logical ‘AND’ is applied between criteria sets.

fields.name: action
fields.description: The action applied by the Internet Firewall if the rule is matched

fields.name: tracking
fields.description: Tracking information when the rule is matched, such as events and notifications

fields.name: schedule
fields.description: The time period specifying when the rule is enabled, otherwise it is disabled.

fields.name: activePeriod
fields.description: The time period during which the rule is active, outside this period, the rule is inactive

fields.name: exceptions
fields.description:
The set of exceptions for the rule.
Exceptions define when the rule will be ignored and the firewall evaluation will continue with the lower priority rules.

fields.description: Unique internal Cato ID for the Socket

fields.name: name

fields.name: connected

fields.name: haRole
fields.description: Shows if this is the primary or secondary Socket in high availability mode

fields.name: interfaces
fields.description: Snapshot data for outbound facing interfaces

fields.name: lastConnected
fields.description: The last time the device was seen

fields.name: lastDuration
fields.description: The uptime of the last tunnel from this device (or current), in seconds

fields.name: connectedSince

fields.name: lastPopID

fields.name: lastPopName

fields.name: recentConnections

fields.name: type

fields.name: deviceUptime

fields.name: socketInfo

fields.description:
Information of the link state of various interfaces in the devices. Unlike the `interfacess` field, it contains
all links of the device, not just the outbound facing ones

fields.name: osType
fields.description: Operating system of the Device.

fields.name: osVersion
fields.description: Version of the Socket operating system

fields.name: version
fields.description: Device version

fields.name: versionNumber
fields.description: Device major version

fields.name: releaseGroup

fields.name: mfaExpirationTime
fields.description: Shows the amount of time remaining before the MFA token expires

fields.name: mfaCreationTime
fields.description: The time the mfa cookie (for sdp users) was created

fields.name: internalIP
fields.description: Device's internal IP in the account's routing table

fields.name: connected

fields.description: Interface ID for the WAN link

fields.name: name
fields.description: WAN link name in the Cato Management Application

fields.name: physicalPort

fields.name: previousPopName
fields.description: The name of the PoP that the WAN link was connected to before the current one

fields.name: tunnelConnectionReason
fields.description: Reason that the tunnel required a new connection (for example, PoP or Socket restarted)

fields.name: tunnelUptime
fields.description: Number of seconds that the tunnel is connected to a PoP

fields.name: tunnelRemoteIP
fields.description: IP address of the WAN ISP

fields.name: tunnelRemoteIPInfo
fields.description: IP address, ISP, and geographical information related to the WAN ISP

fields.name: info
fields.description: data about the WAN link that is configured in the Socket Configuration window for the site

fields.name: cellularInterfaceInfo
fields.description: Information about cellular (LTE) interface

fields.name: bgpState
fields.description: State of the BGP tunnel to the Cato Cloud

fields.name: duration
fields.description: total amount of time for the site data

fields.name: granularity
fields.description: duration in seconds for a single metrics bucket

fields.name: bytesDownstream
fields.description: total downstream traffic (from the Cato Cloud to the site)

fields.name: bytesUpstream
fields.description: total upstream traffic (from the site to the Cato Cloud)

fields.name: bytesTotal
fields.description: total traffic for the site

fields.name: lostDownstream
fields.description: number of packets lost for downstream traffic

fields.name: lostDownstreamPcnt
fields.description: percent of packet loss for downstream traffic

fields.name: lostUpstream
fields.description: number of packets lost for upstream traffic

fields.name: lostUpstreamPcnt
fields.description: percent of packet loss for upstream traffic

fields.name: packetsDownstream
fields.description: total downstream packets

fields.name: packetsUpstream
fields.description: total upstream packets

fields.name: jitterUpstream
fields.description: jitter for upstream traffic (difference in time delay in milliseconds (ms) between data packets)

fields.name: jitterDownstream
fields.description: jitter for downstream traffic (difference in time delay in milliseconds (ms) between data packets)

fields.name: packetsDiscardedDownstream
fields.description: total packets discarded for downstream traffic

fields.name: packetsDiscardedUpstream
fields.description: total packets discarded for upstream traffic

fields.name: rtt
fields.description: round-trip time from the site to the Cato Cloud

fields.name: hostCount
fields.description: The number of hosts in the tunnel. Relevant only for per site Metrics, ignored in per-interface metrics.

fields.name: hostLimit
fields.description:
The configurable limit of the number of hosts in the tunnel. Relevant only for per site Metrics, ignored in
per-interface metrics.

fields.name: flowCount
fields.description:
The number of flows (connections) in the tunnel. Relevant only for per site Metrics, ignored in per-interface
metrics.

fields.name: networkType
fields.description: 2G, 3G, or 4G

fields.name: simSlotId
fields.description: Shows the currently active SIM slot; the other slot is in standby. Slot 1 is active by default.

fields.name: modemStatus
fields.description: Represents the current status of the modem. Valid values are Error, OK, or Unknown.

fields.name: isModemConnected
fields.description: Indicates if the cellular modem is currently connected to the internet.

fields.name: iccid
fields.description: Unique identifier (20-digit number) for the modem.

fields.name: imei
fields.description: Unique identifier (15-digit number) for a specific SIM.

fields.name: operatorName
fields.description: Displays the operator or carrier name, such as Verizon.

fields.name: isModemSuspended
fields.description: Indicates if the modem is currently suspended.

fields.name: apn
fields.description: Represents the Access Point Name (e.g., uwap.orange.co.il). Configurable from Socket WebUI or SIM switch.

fields.name: apnSelectionMethod
fields.description: Determines how the APN is selected. Valid values are Auto or Manual (configurable in WebUI).

fields.name: signalStrength
fields.description: Represents the signal strength of the cellular connection, in units of calculation.

fields.name: isRoamingAllowed
fields.description: Indicates whether roaming is enabled.

fields.name: simNumber
fields.description: The phone number associated with the SIM.

fields.name: disconnectionReason
fields.description: Displays the reason for the modem disconnecting. Valid values are 0 (No reason provided) or 1 (The session timed out).

fields.name: isSimSlot1Detected
fields.description: Indicates whether a SIM is detected in the first slot.

fields.name: isSimSlot2Detected
fields.description: Indicates whether a SIM is detected in the second slot.

enumValues.name: connected

enumValues.name: disconnected
enumValues.description: Disconnected from the Cato Cloud

enumValues.description: Passing traffic

enumValues.description: Disabled in the Cato Management Application

enumValues.name: locked
enumValues.description: License has expired for this site and you can't configure it

enumValues.name: new
enumValues.description: After you create the site before it is connected to the Cato Cloud

enumValues.name: pending_user_configuration
enumValues.description: For VPN users only

enumValues.name: pending_mfa_configuration
enumValues.description: For VPN users only

enumValues.name: pending_code_generation
enumValues.description: For VPN users only

fields.name: operationalStatus

fields.name: name
fields.description: User name from configuration, same as info.name

fields.name: deviceName
fields.description: The host name of the device

fields.name: uptime

inputFields.name: ruleType
inputFields.description:
Determines which rule configuration to use.
When set to APPLICATION, only applicationRule should be used.
When set to DATA, only dataRule should be used.
When set to FILE, only fileRule should be used

inputFields.name: applicationRule
inputFields.description: Defines application control settings. Must only be used when ruleType is APPLICATION
inputFields.defaultValue: {application: {applicationType: []}, applicationActivitySatisfy: ANY, applicationActivity: [], applicationContext: {applicationTenant: []}, accessMethod: [], source: {country: [], host: [], site: [], subnet: [], ip: [], ipRange: [], globalIpRange: [], networkInterface: [], siteNetworkSubnet: [], floatingSubnet: [], user: [], usersGroup: [], group: [], systemGroup: []}, device: [], action: BLOCK, tracking: {event: {enabled: false}, alert: {enabled: false, frequency: HOURLY, subscriptionGroup: [], webhook: [], mailingList: []}}, schedule: {activeOn: ALWAYS}, severity: HIGH, applicationCriteriaSatisfy: ANY, applicationCriteria: {attributes: {complianceAttributes: {iso27001: ANY, sox: ANY, hippa: ANY, soc1: ANY, soc2: ANY, soc3: ANY, isae3402: ANY, pciDss: ANY}, securityAttributes: {mfa: ANY, encryptionAtRest: ANY, auditTrail: ANY, rbac: ANY, rememberPassword: ANY, sso: ANY, trustedCertificate: ANY, tlsEnforcement: ANY, httpSecurityHeaders: ANY}}, originCountry: [], risk: []}}

inputFields.name: dataRule
inputFields.description: Defines data control settings. Must only be used when ruleType is DATA
inputFields.defaultValue: {application: {applicationType: []}, applicationContext: {applicationTenant: []}, applicationActivitySatisfy: ANY, applicationActivity: [], accessMethod: [], source: {country: [], host: [], site: [], subnet: [], ip: [], ipRange: [], globalIpRange: [], networkInterface: [], siteNetworkSubnet: [], floatingSubnet: [], user: [], usersGroup: [], group: [], systemGroup: []}, device: [], action: BLOCK, tracking: {event: {enabled: false}, alert: {enabled: false, frequency: HOURLY, subscriptionGroup: [], webhook: [], mailingList: []}}, schedule: {activeOn: ALWAYS}, severity: HIGH, fileAttributeSatisfy: ANY, fileAttribute: [], dlpProfile: {contentProfile: [], edmProfile: []}}

inputFields.name: fileRule
inputFields.description: Defines file control settings. Must only be used when ruleType is FILE
inputFields.defaultValue: {application: {applicationType: []}, applicationActivitySatisfy: ANY, applicationActivity: [], accessMethod: [], source: {country: [], host: [], site: [], subnet: [], ip: [], ipRange: [], globalIpRange: [], networkInterface: [], siteNetworkSubnet: [], floatingSubnet: [], user: [], usersGroup: [], group: [], systemGroup: []}, device: [], action: BLOCK, tracking: {event: {enabled: false}, alert: {enabled: false, frequency: HOURLY, subscriptionGroup: [], webhook: [], mailingList: []}}, schedule: {activeOn: ALWAYS}, severity: HIGH, fileAttributeSatisfy: ANY, fileAttribute: []}

inputFields.name: revision
inputFields.description:
A revision is a specific instance of the policy.
 Unpublished revisions are working copies of the policy available to a specific
 admin or a set of admins
 Published revisions are revisions that were applied to the account network.
 The last published revision is the active policy.

fields.description: Globally defined IP range, IP and subnet objects

fields.name: customService

fields.name: remoteAsn
fields.description: Remote Autonomous System Number (ASN)

fields.name: service
fields.description: Add the Service Type to which this TLS inspection rule applies

fields.description: System categories for TLS inspection policy

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

directives.name: beta
directives.description:
The @beta directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate beta portions of a
GraphQL service's schema, such as beta fields, enum values, arguments or input fields.

directives.name: ga
directives.description:
The @ga directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate GA portions of a
GraphQL service's schema, such as GA fields, enum values, arguments or input fields.

directives.name: ea
directives.description:
The @ea directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate EA portions of a
GraphQL service's schema.

directives.name: rollout
directives.description:
The @rollout directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate portions of a
GraphQL service's schema that is gradually rolling out. This APIs will be available to all accounts after a few weeks.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.
